page.title: 20LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: {CHURCH }In the townland of Crebilly there is a field named the Priest's Plain. Tradition holds that Mass was celebrated on a rock altar there. {SCHOOL }The earliest school in Crebilly, consisting of two classrooms, was built in 1837. Amore modern edifice was erected in 1910. 64 years later, this school was closed, being replaced by one nearer the town on the Larne Rd. {CASTLE}Associated with many of the lords of the area including the Waveneys,the O'Haras and Robinsons. Destroyed by fire during the troubles of 1921. Demolished 1940's.Fine bungalow now occupies site, which commands an extensive view to Slemish inthe East to the distant Sperrins in the West.Only remnant is coat of arms.Motto"Try".Lion,unicorn crest.
